intro: Horkelia californica var. paucifoliolata, commonly known as the Sierra horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple flowers. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to arid and semi-arid environments.
